description: Draft GitHub issues for orchestration analyzer enhancements

issues.title: Rate Limiting & Exponential Backoff for REST Retrieval
issues.summary: Implement intelligent retry logic with exponential backoff for REST API artifact retrieval to handle transient failures and respect GitHub's rate limits.
acceptance_criteria: Add rate limit detection from response headers
Configure max retries and backoff parameters
Add structured logging for retry attempts
Include unit tests for retry logic
Display remaining rate limit in debug mode
Provide clear error messages when rate limited

issues.title: Streaming Artifact Extraction to Reduce Peak Memory
issues.summary: Stream ZIP extraction and parsing to reduce memory footprint and improve startup time for large artifact collections.
acceptance_criteria: Parse JSON files incrementally using streaming parser
Write large files directly to disk without memory buffering
Ensure error handling for corrupted ZIPs
Add unit tests with mocked ZIP streams

issues.title: Externalized Config File for Artifact Names & Severity Thresholds
issues.summary: Enable configuration via external JSON/YAML files for artifact names, severity mappings, gating thresholds, and other settings.
acceptance_criteria: Support both JSON and YAML formats
Load config from multiple sources with priority order
Provide clear error messages for invalid config
Include example configs for common scenarios
Add unit tests for config loading

issues.title: Visual Diff Integration Pipeline
issues.summary: Integrate visual regression testing with baseline comparison and automated diff generation for UI changes.
acceptance_criteria: Choose visual diff provider (Percy, Chromatic, or self-hosted)
Implement screenshot extraction from Playwright artifacts
Add visual regression issues to consolidated report
Include before/after images in PR comments
Add approval workflow for intentional changes
Add visual diff results to gating logic

issues.title: Flakiness Historical Storage (Persist Test Results Snapshot)
issues.summary: Store minimal test result snapshots over time to track flakiness trends and test suite health metrics.
acceptance_criteria: Choose storage backend (DynamoDB, S3, or GitHub Gist)
Implement snapshot creation from Playwright results
Store snapshot after each workflow run analysis
Add CLI command to query historical data
Generate flakiness report with historical context
Include historical context in main analysis report
Document storage schema and query patterns
Add migration tool for future schema changes
Include integration tests with mocked storage

issues.title: Extended Secret Redaction Patterns
issues.summary: Expand secret redaction to cover JWTs, private keys, cloud credentials, database URLs, and other sensitive patterns.
acceptance_criteria: Implement extended secret pattern library (20+ patterns)
Support custom patterns via config file
Redact secrets in artifact contents, errors, PR comments, and exports
Include entropy analysis for generic secrets
Add unit tests with real-world secret examples

issues.title: Performance Profiling Harness for Large Artifacts
issues.summary: Add comprehensive performance profiling to identify bottlenecks and track optimization improvements over time.
acceptance_criteria: Add timing to all major phases
Capture memory usage at key checkpoints
Track artifact size and file counts
Include performance data in JSON output
Add CLI command to compare performance across runs
Support exporting profiles to Chrome DevTools

issues.title: PR Comment Templating & Localization Support
issues.summary: Implement template system with i18n support for customizable, multi-language PR comments and notifications.
acceptance_criteria: Add i18n support with multiple locales
Create default templates (PR full, summary, Slack, email, plain text)
Support custom templates via config file
Document template syntax and available variables
Add unit tests for template rendering

notes: These enhancements are designed to improve the orchestration analyzer's reliability, performance, flexibility, and security. Most have no blocking dependencies and can be implemented in parallel.
